title: How to Make a Mason Jar Foaming Hand Soap Dispenser

steps.headline: Create dispenser lid template using a pencil and paper.
steps.description:
The easiest way to cut a hold on top of the mason jar lid is to create a paper template. Trace around the base of the hand soap nozzle. Remove dispensing pump from soap bottle and try to trace around the base, right above the thin tubing that goes into the soap. steps.headline: Center template in the middle of the mason jar lid and tape in place.
steps.description: Make sure you have enough room around the jar sides so that the lid does not crack or break when you cut out the template.

steps.headline: Cut out template using either a drill press or an electric handsaw.
steps.description: If using the saw, you may need to get the circle started by first drilling a hole on one side of the template.

steps.headline: Remove center cut out and place soap pump through hole.
steps.description: It should fit perfectly. Remove pump in order to seal the inside of the circle.

steps.headline: Coat the inner rim of the cut circle with a thin layer of rubber cement or silicone glue.
steps.description: This will prevent the soap from spilling in case the jar is tipped over. Allow for ample dry time before assembling the jar.

steps.headline: Pour hand soap into the jar, place pump through cut hole in mason jar lid and screw it on tightly.

text:
Create dispenser lid template using a pencil and paper. The easiest way to cut a hold on top of the mason jar lid is to create a paper template. Trace around the base of the hand soap nozzle. Remove dispensing pump from soap bottle and try to trace around the base, right above the thin tubing that goes into the soap. It may be tricky with the tubing in place but do your best to get at least a rough trace. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/8f\/Make-a-Mason-Jar-Foaming-Hand-Soap-Dispenser-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Mason-Jar-Foaming-Hand-Soap-Dispenser-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/8f\/Make-a-Mason-Jar-Foaming-Hand-Soap-Dispenser-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Mason-Jar-Foaming-Hand-Soap-Dispenser-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

Make sure you have enough room around the jar sides so that the lid does not crack or break when you cut out the template. Cut out template using either a drill press or an electric handsaw. If using the saw, you may need to get the circle started by first drilling a hole on one side of the template. Remove center cut out and place soap pump through hole. It should fit perfectly. Remove pump in order to seal the inside of the circle. Coat the inner rim of the cut circle with a thin layer of rubber cement or silicone glue. This will prevent the soap from spilling in case the jar is tipped over. Allow for ample dry time before assembling the jar. Pour hand soap into the jar, place pump through cut hole in mason jar lid and screw it on tightly.
